prompt: Facts: Marriage between Nithu (deceased) and Sanu George (Accused No. 3 - A3, son of Appellant Mable George) solemnized on February 11, 2007.; Nithu was found hanging in her matrimonial home on July 14, 2007, approximately five months after the marriage.; Initial FIR registered under Section 174 CrPC (unnatural death).; Following complaints by the deceased's parents alleging dowry harassment, the High Court ordered a re-investigation.; Chargesheet filed against Mable George (Appellant/Mother-in-law - A1), George Kutty (Father-in-law - A2), and Sanu George (Husband - A3) under Sections 498A, 304B, and 306 read with Section 34 IPC.; Prosecution alleged demands for remaining dowry (gold ornaments) and money for A3's business/vehicle, coupled with mental and physical harassment.; Key prosecution witnesses included PW1 (father), PW2 (mother), PW4 (uncle), PW5 (priest), PW6 (relative), and PW7 (neighbour), testifying to demands and harassment.; Post-mortem report (PW17 - Forensic Surgeon) indicated death due to asphyxia consistent with hanging; ligature mark observed.; Trial Court convicted A1, A2, and A3 under Sections 498A, 304B, and 306 r/w 34 IPC. Sentenced to RI for 2 years (498A), 7 years (304B), and 7 years (306), concurrently.; High Court, on appeal, acquitted A3 (husband) but confirmed the conviction and sentence for A1 (Mable George) and A2 (George Kutty).; Mable George (A1) filed the present appeal before the Supreme Court. A2 did not appeal.; Supreme Court specifically noted the short duration between marriage and death (approx. 5 months). | IPC: Section 34 (Acts done by several persons in furtherance of common intention), Section 304B (Dowry death), Section 306 (Abetment of suicide), Section 498A (Husband or relative of husband of a woman subjecting her to cruelty)
